pullrequest.title: Fix issue 2111 by providing options to preserve world velocity when set positions

content.raw: This is looking good to me. But it looks like right now the `_preserveWorldVelocity` is being completely ignored in the derived classes. We don't have to implement the flag in all physics engines, but we should be sure to notify the user if `_preserveWorldVelocity` is set to a value that is not the current behavior of the physics engine instead of ignoring it and performing the current behavior anyway. Also don't forget to add the flag to `simbody/SimbodyJoint` and `dart/DARTJoint` as well.
content.html: This is looking good to me. But it looks like right now the _preserveWorldVelocity is being completely ignored in the derived classes. We don't have to implement the flag in all physics engines, but we should be sure to notify the user if _preserveWorldVelocity is set to a value that is not the current behavior of the physics engine instead of ignoring it and performing the current behavior anyway. Also don't forget to add the flag to simbody/SimbodyJoint and dart/DARTJoint as well.

content.raw: I'm not sure if the velocity here is zero because `SetPosition` zeroed them, or because `ResetPhysicsStates` set them to zero and then `SetPosition` just preserved them. Should we reapply forces after resetting the states?

pullrequest.title: Fix issue 2111 by providing options to preserve world velocity when set positions

content.raw:
I figured out what was off about the test and fixed it here 6bc3cba

To summarize: It wasn't really testing the difference between the old behavior and the new optional behavior. Whether or not you passed the `true` flag to `SetPositions(~)` on line 687, the test would pass because the reset was changing things to zero.

In the modified version, I removed the resets, so we can be confident that the zeroing is coming from the `SetPositions(~)` call. Indeed, if you pass it the optional `true` flag, it will now fail. Also, I had to filter out DART from being tested, because the new optional behavior is undefined for DART (as well as for Simbody, so that's filtered out as well).

I think the test should make sense now.
content.html:
I figured out what was off about the test and fixed it here 6bc3cba

To summarize: It wasn't really testing the difference between the old behavior and the new optional behavior. Whether or not you passed the true flag to SetPositions(~) on line 687, the test would pass because the reset was changing things to zero.

In the modified version, I removed the resets, so we can be confident that the zeroing is coming from the SetPositions(~) call. Indeed, if you pass it the optional true flag, it will now fail. Also, I had to filter out DART from being tested, because the new optional behavior is undefined for DART (as well as for Simbody, so that's filtered out as well).

I think the test should make sense now.

pullrequest.title: Fix issue 2111 by providing options to preserve world velocity when set positions

content.raw: Also note: I had to remove the `world->Step(1)` because after taking a step, the child body would no longer have zero velocity as the parent would immediately transfer some of its momentum to the child. The parent body doesn't seem to have a parent joint, so we cannot call `SetPosition(~)` on it to zero its velocity.
content.html: Also note: I had to remove the world->Step(1) because after taking a step, the child body would no longer have zero velocity as the parent would immediately transfer some of its momentum to the child. The parent body doesn't seem to have a parent joint, so we cannot call SetPosition(~) on it to zero its velocity.

pullrequest.title: Fix issue 2111 by providing options to preserve world velocity when set positions

content.raw:
This is also why I removed the line that tests the parent's velocity. The velocity-zeroing effect of `SetPosition(~)` only affects the child's velocity and the relative velocity between them.

Logically, this should imply that the parent's velocity will also be zeroed, except the effect of the zeroing won't get transferred upstream until the next time step. However, when that transfer does happen, it effectively averages out their velocities because of conservation of momentum.
content.html:
This is also why I removed the line that tests the parent's velocity. The velocity-zeroing effect of SetPosition(~) only affects the child's velocity and the relative velocity between them.

Logically, this should imply that the parent's velocity will also be zeroed, except the effect of the zeroing won't get transferred upstream until the next time step. However, when that transfer does happen, it effectively averages out their velocities because of conservation of momentum.

pullrequest.title: Fix issue 2111 by providing options to preserve world velocity when set positions

content.raw:
new windows compiler warning:

~~~
ODEJoint.hh:93, MSBuild, Priority: Normal
'gazebo::physics::ODEJoint::SetPosition':
 virtual function overrides 'gazebo::physics::Joint::SetPosition',
 previous versions of the compiler did not override when parameters only differed by const/volatile qualifiers
~~~

it looks like `const` was added to some arguments in the `Joint` class but it wasn't propagated to the downstream classes

I'll try to make them consistent
content.html:
new windows compiler warning:

ODEJoint.hh:93, MSBuild, Priority: Normal
'gazebo::physics::ODEJoint::SetPosition':
 virtual function overrides 'gazebo::physics::Joint::SetPosition',
 previous versions of the compiler did not override when parameters only differed by const/volatile qualifiers

it looks like const was added to some arguments in the Joint class but it wasn't propagated to the downstream classes

I'll try to make them consistent
